BAKE SALE FOR LEBANON ??????: Today is the last day to place an order for the bake sale organized by Amanda Haj Hassan and @haneen.amhaz. All proceeds will go to the Lebanese Red Cross and aid people affected by the explosion in Beirut. For more information on the bake sale, please dm @haneen.amhaz.

Lebanon, your pain is our pain, your loss is our loss, and your happiness is our happiness. Our heart aches for Beirut but we have faith that you will rise from the ashes stronger than ever before! ?????? To the international community, the tragic explosion that took place on August 4 at Beirut’s port caused severe infrastructural damages, hundreds of deaths, and thousands who got injured. Lebanon needs our support now more than ever ????????. If you can, please consider donating to the following charities and local NGOs in ????: 1. Lebanese Red Cross 2. Lebanese Food Bank 3. Beit al Baraka 4. Impact Lebanon 5. Open Houses Lebanon Or visit https://lebanoncrisis.carrd.co/ for a full list.
Wishing everyone a very happy Easter! Enjoy this amazing day and stay healthy and safe ??

In light of the situation unfolding with COVID-19 / SARS-CoV-2, the UBC Arab Student Association has chosen to follow the advice of the Canadian health authorities and the World Health Organization to practice social distancing. As such, the ASA executive team has decided to cancel the Arabian Nights Gala. The team has spent a lot of time and effort on this event, and we were excited to bring together the Arab community through a large celebration of our culture. While we won't be able to do this for the time being, we hope we can continue to build a strong community at UBC and in the broader Vancouver area now and in the future. We would like to recognize the contributions of all of our members, our sponsors, our performers, and our non-exec event planners who generously volunteered their time to this event. Without them, an event of this magnitude would never have been a possibility. We hope that despite the cancellation this year, ASA teams in the future can use the relationships we've built for a similar event in the coming years. Everyone who bought a ticket will be reimbursed. If you purchased a ticket through Showpass, we will reimburse you through their site automatically. If you purchased a ticket from our booth, we will message you or you can reach out to us for reimbursement. We want to encourage everyone to prioritize their safety and listen to health authorities to get through this difficult time. We hope to see you in our events the future. Best regards, The ASA Executive Team
Early Bird Sales end March 15th! Tickets are going quick, we are 30% sold out! Ticket link on the Facebook event page or on the instagram bio

What does the Arabian Nights Gala entail? Here's our itinerary for the night. From music to dancing to performances to amazing food, you can't miss it. Let this be a night where we celebrate Arab culture in the best way Arabs know how: a party! Ticket link in ig bio or on the Facebook event page.

Do you miss the livlihood of your home country? Think back to the last Arab wedding you went to. Think about the culture and the community, the loud music and the dancing, the fancy dresses and the fitted suits, the delicious food and the happiness. At the ASA's Arabian Nights Gala, we will recreate that feeling of home. With traditional performances like the Dabkeh and a bellydancing performance, in addition to Arabic music, a photobooth, and delicious Middle Eastern food, come ready to have the night of your life. Early bird tickets on sale now. Link in bio or on the Facebook event page, at a discounted price for a limited time only!

Are you looking to build your own brand? Do you want to improve your chances of employment? UBC Global Lounge, in partnership with Arab Students Association at UBC. & Sponsor a Child's Education UBC present Build your own Brand! A professional development workshop that will help you market yourself and expose you to more job opportunities. This event will provide you with the right tools to help you stand out in today’s competitive job market. The event includes: - A Keynote speaker that will highlight the importance of being up to date with current events, trends, and issues surrounding the job market, as well as how political/social factors affect your chances of finding the job you want - A resume workshop to help you create the right resume for your dream job - Brainstorm session on how to brand yourself, and market your brand February 11, 6:00 PM to 8:00 PM UBC Global Lounge (2205 Lower Mall: Marine Drive Building 1, right next to Point Grill) Snacks will be provided, so please RSVP by clicking 'going' on the Facebook event page ------------------------------------- We acknowledge that this event and all other events at the UBC Global Lounge are taking place on unceded, traditional and ancestral territory of the h?n?q??min??m? speaking x?m??k??y??m (Musqueam) people.

Student Success Story: Rachel Helwig-Henseleit ?? ? ? ? Major in English Language and Literature, Minor in Creative Writing ? ? Rachel's co-op experiences have allowed her to connect her passion for creative writing and storytelling with postgraduate aspirations to work in communications. ? ? While with the Fig Leaf Group and Mitacs, Rachel gained hands-on experience in drafting copy for websites and social media, updating newsletters, and creating content. Notably, during her Marketing Co-op at Mitacs, she crafted a viral Taylor Swift reel that garnered significant attention, boosting engagement and reach. ? ? Rachel's journey showcases the perfect blend of academics and practical experience. Click the link in bio to learn more about her co-op journey.

Happy New Year and first week of school! ? ? Gear up for success with these job posting tips as you begin the summer co-op search: ? ? ???Federal government postings mostly close Jan-Feb. ? ???Private sector jobs are steady all term. ? ??Non-profit postings surge from April-May. * ? ? * Note for international students: January-March is prime time for diverse opportunities, as many non-profits rely on federal wage subsidies, which international students are not be eligible for. ? ? Let's conquer those career goals in 2024! ??

?? As we approach the holiday break, consider using this time for a well-deserved rest while also planning for the upcoming term. ? ? Here's a checklist to keep in mind: ? ? ?? Create a master resume. ? ??? Organize additional documents. ? ?? Stay in touch with references.

Student Success Story: Caitlin Paterson ?? ? ? Major in Psychology, Minor in Journalism and Society ? ? Caitlin made significant contributions during her work term at Transport Canada as a Communications Assistant, where she excelled in designing graphics and producing video interviews. ? ? Caitlin's impact extended beyond design; she also crafted daily media monitoring reports for the Regional Emergency Coordination Centre, providing valuable insights for disaster response. Furthermore, she actively supported national advertising campaigns for the Federal Ocean's Protection Plan and played a pivotal role in facilitating large-scale events and ministerial visits. ? ? Participating in the Arts Co-op Program allowed Caitlin to build a robust design portfolio, gain confidence in interviews, and establish a valuable network through Arts Co-op conferences. This experience will undoubtedly provide her with a head start in the competitive job market, laying the foundation for a successful career in communications. ? ? Head to the link in bio, to learn more about her co-op journey.

Let's talk about "internships". ? ? Like, what exactly is an "internship", and does it actually align with your career goals? ? ? Uncover the truth behind the term and discover how to make your career experiences truly impactful.? ? ?? Link in bio for the full scoop!

?? A new term means new opportunities! ? ? Reflect, reassess, and recalibrate your academic plan. It's okay if the last term didn't go exactly as you planned—it's all part of the journey. ? ? Keep pushing forward with the advice, and resources at our link in bio!

Last year, UBC Arts and @ubcappliedscience students teamed up in the new 'Humanitarian Engineering' course, crafting solutions for real-world challenges.? ? From innovating water solutions in B.C.'s Lytton First Nation to designing flood-resistant sanitation in India, their empathy-driven approach is sparking meaningful change!? ? Learn more about these students and this innovative new course at our Link in Bio!
Happy holidays, Faculty of Arts! Enjoy your well-deserved break after finishing Winter Term 1! ????

???? Dive into the captivating world of Fish Tales! ?? ? ? Discover how a collaboration between @ubcinstrcc and the @gogcannery is bridging cultures & communities. From class project to a vibrant exhibit, UBC students & Cannery staff teamed up to celebrate diverse voices sharing tales about seafood and customs.? ? "It has been very gratifying to see Fish Tales evolve from a class project in 2021, to now an exhibit at the Cannery. Our team at UBC values the ethic of student-centered, student-led teaching and learning, and this project is a great example of how something small can into into something impactful for the community.” - Dr. Henry Yu, Professor, @ubc_history? ? Learn more about this community-university partnership at our link in bio!

?? Time to thrive! Thrive month is a time when the UBC community comes together to learn about, talk about, and explore ways to support our mental health. For this year’s thrive month, the Department of Asian Studies held a Pastel Nagomi Art Workshop, where students applied a hands-on painting technique using soft pastels and fingers. Don’t forget to swipe to see some of the art our talented students made! The Department is also currently giving out snacks in the main office to help students refuel after a long day of classes. ?? Explore UBC’s various thrive month initiatives through the link in our bio! #ubcasia

Wishing everyone a happy Diwali filled with the warmth of love, the light of wisdom, and a heart full of happiness and gratitude! Thanks to all who made it to our Diwali event last Wednesday hosted by our lovely folks at the Asian Library and the Hindi-Urdu Language Program!???

?? Looking for an opportunity to travel, learn, and get course credit? Check out the various Summer Global Seminars being offered in 2024! FNIS 360, led by Dr. Pasang Yangjee Sherpa, explores global Indigeneity in the ancestral territory of the Newa people, now known as the Kathmandu Valley in Nepal. ?? With many 2024 Summer Global Seminars offering funding to cover 50% - 100% of students’ program costs, this is an opportunity you wouldn’t want to miss. ?? Apply by Dec. 5 and learn more through the link in our bio.

?????A big thank you to all who attended Persian Literature Reading Club’s first session hosted by Dr. Farzan Sojoodi and Dr. Hessam Dehghani featuring guest Dr. Amir Ali Nojoumian on “History and it’s Representation in Literature: The Bewilderment of Discourses”which discussed: ? Theoretical discussions about the relationship between history, literature, and art ? Analysis of the novel “Island of ?Bewilderment” by Simin Daneshvar ? The world of the “island of bewilderment” and the world of the 1950s until the occurrence of the 1979 revolution Join the club’s next session on November 25th and check out asia.ubc.ca/events to RSVP and for more info!

??Join our Pastel Nagomi Art Workshop and learn from a certified instructor on how to create beautiful and heart-warming artwork using soft pastels and fingers that will soothe the mind. ??With origins from Japan, Pastel Nagomi Art presents a simple way of painting that cultivates hope, healing, and happiness from simple yet unique painting techniques. The word “Nagomi” (?) means harmony and calmness. ??No previous experience is required. Free and open to all Asian Studies graduate and major students. ??RSVP through the link in our bio now – space is limited! #ubcasia

IN ONE WEEK! Beaty Nocturnal - Containers of Curiosities with artist Eden Zinchik, is next Thursday, January 18! The #BeatyMuseum will have admission by donation from 5:00 pm. Visit between 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm to see and talk about these organisms and join a tour of invasive species in the collection at 7:00 pm. The museum will be open until 8:30 pm! Eden Zinchik (she/her) is an international researcher, designer, and artist, and a recent graduate with a BDes in Industrial Design at Emily Carr University of Art + Design in Vancouver, Canada. Read all about this special event at beatymuseum.ubc.ca/calendar @e.den_zinchik #UBCevents #UBCcampus #YVRevents #SciArt #BeatyNocturnal #Biodiversity #YVRlife #UBClife

The first Nature Club of the year is this Saturday, January 6, from 10:30 am to 1:00 pm, and this month we will learn about #Entomology, the study of #insects. Join one of the mini-workshops on Insect Magnification for Beginners at 11:00, 11:30, 12:00, or 12:30. We’ll discuss different tools that entomologists use to magnify insects. We’ll lead you through the steps to use a stereo/dissecting microscope and you can try it out (for ages 5+). Magnifying glasses will be available to use for younger scientists. Mini workshops are first-come, first-serve. Visit the link to read more: beatymuseum.ubc.ca/natureclub Thanks to the generous support of Campus and Community Planning, UBC campus families can take part for free! #UBCscience #UBCevents #YVRevents #FamilyFun #UBCO #UBC #Biodiversity #UBCzoology @ubcscience @zoologyubc @utownubc @unacommunity @campusubc
The Beaty Biodiversity Museum team wishes you a wonderful holiday season! #Biodiversity #BCmuseums #UBCscience #MuseumsEh #HappyHolidays #Happy2024

New Researchers Revealed video, "Visual Communication" with Jacelyn Shu! Jacelyn Shu is a Lab Manager at the Biodiversity Research Centre at the University of British Columbia. Jacelyn learned how to do digital scientific illustration during her Masters in the Department of Zoology, she has since made illustrations for numerous researchers to help communicate their work. Supported by UBC's Grants for Catalyzing Research Clusters, Jacelyn ran a scientific illustration workshop for students in the Biodiversity Research Centre. Videography by Derek Tan, Mia Waters, and David Weng. Editing by David Weng. www.beatymuseum.ubc.ca explore.beatymuseum.ubc.ca/researchers-revealed @universityofbc @ubcscience @zoologyubc @jacejostles #sciart #scicomm #biodiversity #zoology #scienceillustration #scienceillustrator

New Researchers Revealed video: Digitization of the Beaty with the Museums Assistance Program! Find out how a natural history collection is digitized with Mark Pitblado, Curator of Informatics at the Beaty Biodiversity Museum at the University of British Columbia in Vancouver. Lead Curatorial Assistant, Chris Stinson, also shows us the 3D scanner and tells us about working with Specify, an open-source database system. The digitization of the collection is supported by the Museums Assistance Program - Digital Access to Heritage, from the Government of Canada. www.canada.ca/en/canadian-heritage/services/funding/museums-assistance.html Watch the full video on our YouTube channel @BeatyMuseum or visit explore.beatymuseum.ubc.ca/researchers-revealed - links in Bio! #scicomm #biodiversity #BCmuseums #museums #museumseh #ubc #UBCscience @ubcscience @universityofbc

We’re honoured to present "As far as I can gather" featuring the artwork of jasna guy, on display at the Beaty Biodiversity Museum until June 2, 2024. In this new #SciArt exhibition, you will see the artist's process of collecting specimens and using a range of tools, materials, and techniques, including a microscope, to come closer to intricate structures invisible to the naked eye - from the microscopic to the gigantic representation of the ecosystems that surround us. Visit beatymuseum.ubc.ca/exhibitions/current-exhibitions to read more! #biodiversity #BCmuseums #VancouverAttractions #YVRlife #UBCevents #YVRevents #UBCcampus

Nature Club "Mammals" is coming up on Saturday, December 2 from 10:30 am to 1:00 pm. Enjoy special activities for families plus all of our regular museum programming, Raising Big Blue documentary, museum tour, and more! Mammals are a group of warm-blooded animals with backbones and include musk oxs, humans, and blue whales. Visit the Cowan Tetrapod collection at the Beaty Museum to see birds, as well as reptiles, mammals, and amphibians. With over 40,000 specimens representing over 2,500 species, the collection is the second-largest scientific collection of birds, mammals, reptiles, and amphibians in British Columbia. Are you a UBC Campus Family? Thanks to the generous support of Campus and Community Planning, UBC campus families can take part for free! Nature Club is open to all families, and museum admission rates apply. Register at beatymuseum.ubc.ca/natureclub @unacommunity @utownubc @campusubc @ubcscience #UBCevents #YVRevents #YVRlife #UBC #UBCcommunity #biodiversity #BeatyMuseum #vancouverattractions #bcmuseums

Meet MAKING CONNECTIONS’ core development team! This small but mighty group of five are the people behind the development of the future UBC undergraduate course ‘Introduction to Natural History Museums and Biodiversity Science’. Each of our core team members brings a unique set of diverse skills and experiences that have enriched the course's development immensely. At the heart of our team's shared values is a desire to develop a course that centers on diverse perspectives, anticolonial practices, and accessibility. Read more about the Making Connection team at beatymuseum.ubc.ca/blog #UBCTLEF #UBCscience #UBC #SciEd #SciComm #MuseumEducation #biodiversity @ubcscience

Please read regarding what took place on November 17th when we sought to hold the 'Black-Palestinian Transnational Solidarity' event on UBC campus but were subjected to displacement and carceral violence by UBC admin and security. Please call and send emails using the template that @ubcsocialjusticecentre recently released to express your disgust with the targeted and aggressive treatment of BIPOC UBC students. Link in @ubcsocialjusticecentre bio.

“We know too well that our freedom is incomplete without the freedom of the Palestinians" - Nelson Mandela. We invite you to join us this Friday, Nov. 17th from 5-7 pm in the Black Student Space (Exchange Building) to learn about the many intersections between Black and Palestinian liberation struggles. Registration required. Masks required for entry, a limited number will be available at the door for free. An ASL interpreter will be present. IMPORTANT: No harassment or discriminatory attitudes/behaviours will be tolerated during the event, including anti-Blackness, anti-Palestinian racism, antisemitism, Islamophobia, and any other oppressive remarks.
We invite you to join BMC and SPHR UBC in the Nest’s Performance Theatre at 5:30 pm this Thursday as we pray for our brothers and sisters in Palestine.
Now and always, we stand in deep solidarity with the Palestinian people in their cause. We encourage members of our local community to follow @ubcsphr and @ubcsocialjusticecentre to stay informed.

The prayer is a science and an art that takes many years of serious and vigilant practice in order to arrive at its true reality - Agenda to Change Our Condition Welcome to Room to Grow, a workshop where we will discuss the beauty and the challenges of building a prayer practice, with a special emphasis on the needs of Muslims with ADHD. Wherever we are in our prayer practice, whether it's starting with one prayer or wanting to build upon an established prayer routine, there is always room to grow. InshaAllah, we'll meet this Friday at 5:30 pm in the NEST Room 2311 and on Zoom. Registration link is in our bio! About the Workshop Facilitator: Halah Zumrawi is a graduate student in clinical counseling at Antioch University Seattle as well as being a recent graduate of Cambridge Muslim College's Islamic Psychology Diploma. Her research interests include addiction and neurodiversity and how they play out in Muslim and other minoritized populations. She’s spent the past few years working in her communities to lower barriers to culturally relevant mental health care. Halah is grateful to live on the unceded territories of the Musqueam, Squamish and Tsleil-Waututh Indigenous nations in what is colonially known as Vancouver, Canada. Halah always makes time to read, cultivate her love of languages and be near the ocean. She can be reached at adhdandsalah@gmail.com
